Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfy and well situated”
Reviews.Author: Maxim R
Reviews.Content: We went there in February to see a football game and to explore Barcelona. 1) Situation of hotel Well situated. Close to the Metro station Diagonal. 5min. At the corner of the street is also a bus stop. 2min. Next to the entrance to the hotel is a supermarket. 2) Accommodation Friendly at the reception and also the hotel bar. Clean room and bathroom. We had a room next to the bar so it was a bit noisy. Windows were located towards the garden and there was no sun. Most of the time we were exploring the city so it fulfilled what we expected. A positive thing was the machine with free coffee and tee. Have a nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “good value for money with a great staff”
Reviews.Author: afshan m
Reviews.Content: GOOD: The hotel was very clean The rooms are very confusing but the signage is good. The location is pretty safe and as a single traveler that was very important to me The staff was VERY helpful. They recommended places to visit, called a cab when I needed it, got me a fan and even helped me practice my Spanish. I requested the quiet room and got it. It was very peaceful. The ONLY best western on my spain trip that did that for me. THANK YOU! The breakfast is 8 euro and is a continental breakfast. Instead I went to the shop next door and got fresh bakery stuff that I wanted. With nescafe instant sachets that were also available there. The toiletries were awesome too. My room didn't have a view, but that was fine since I just went to the hotel to sleep The staff helped me chose between different places to visit BAD: i really dont have anything bad to say except that it's a walk to the ramblas, but that was okay.

Reviews.Title: “A tad bit north but close enough to the metro”
Reviews.Author: mcm97
Reviews.Content: Pretty decent little hotel for the price! The staff is friendly and speaks English which is rather helpful. You're about a 7 minute walk to the Metro and its in the middle of many of the major attractions. The supermarker next door is a GREAT place to grab a coke and a snack. The only downside to this hotel is that there's a lack of carpet so the mornings are a litte loud

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and convenient”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Barcelona and we were a little nervous when we booked the hotel not knowing anything about the layout of the city in regards to the location of the hotel but the place was located within walking distnace of everything (las ramlas and metro) and the staff was willing to help with navigating our daily activities. The place is nothing fancy but it was safe and clean...we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraPR045
Reviews.Content: This is our hotel in Barcelona. We stayed here twice in 2011 and will certainly return. Good rooms, very clean, helpfull staff. Location is perfect. Busstop around the corner. Bus 17 and 16 to Pl.Catalunya and bus 17 even to Barceloneta. Bus 27 to pl Espanya The neighbourhoud is full of nice little shops, restaurants and a market where you will find the normal daily life - Tip: Ask a detailled bus map at an TMB office.

Reviews.Title: “Best value”
Reviews.Author: Nuha A
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this hotel and we enjoyed every minute. The staff was extremely helpful and responsive. The hotel is centrally located with in walking distance of all. The room was clean and fresh and the breakfast was good. We highly recommend it...

Reviews.Title: “Nice 3 stars hotel in the middle of marvellous Barcelona for Gaudi fans”
Reviews.Author: Dortat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were staying at this hotel for 4 nights and 5 days during our visit to Barcelona. A good 3 stars with a nice breakfast buffet and a wonderful terrace for the smokers (the rooms are non-smoking). Great bathroom, very clean and in perfect functioning conditions. We were lucky to have a room with the window giving to the inner court so we had natural light but not the noise of the street. The hotel is located at 5 min from the crossing of Avenida Diagonal and Avenue Balmes and at 15 min from Paseing de Gracia, where Casa Mila and Casa Battlo are located. We choose the hotel because the theme of our visit was Gaudi, and wanted to be as near as possible to his many creations around the city. We thought we would be able to walk arround to each of them, but we did not foresee that Barcelona is such a big city and walking would take too much of our restricted time. So, with the much appreciated help from the hotel staff (Gloria, we thank you so much for all your good advices!) we start using the marvellous public transportation. The buses 17 and 24 are running on Balmeo down to Paseig de Gracia to the core of Barcelona: Plaza Catalunya. Bus 19 is running from Plaza Catalunya to Sagrada Familia. Metro (subway) line L5 links Diagonal station (15 min from the hotel on Av. Diagonal to the east) to Sagrada Familia and from the same station you can take L3 down to Plaza Catalunya. The bus 24 is also going from the cross-roads Gran de Gracia/ Traverserra de Gracia directely to Park Guell. Aside the Gaudi sites, we went to visit Barri Gothic section (nice cathedral and good shopping) and the port and the beach side, where one can have good seafood restaurants and pleasant atmosphere. Gloria instructed us to get the City Bus Tour and we did, and we recommend that anybody take this tour first thing on arrival: not only it helps to orientation but you get discounts to different museums and visiting sites. Around the hotel area there are many restaurants and coffee shops. Gloria sent us to Moncho's, a buffet style restaurant opened from 10am to 11pm and serving Spanish tapas. We also went (and what a pleasant surprise) to La Flauta II (on Balmes south of Av. Diagonal); take care to go there either before 1pm or after 6pm because there is a long waiting line for table seats. Coffees are great everywhere and ice creams and sweets divine. Only one restaurant we will avoid: the Trobador on Eric Granados south of Av. Diagonal: in spite of the wonderful terrace, the staff chited us blind on both the order and the bill. What we would recommend to improve the quality of the hotel? If the management would consider covering the corridors with wall to wall carpet this would increase the quietness of the place by blocking high-heals, children feet and language rollers noises to get into the rooms during the wee hours in the morning!

Reviews.Title: “its ok but hallways are so loud ... you can hear everyone..”
Reviews.Author: maritez
Reviews.Content: Every space counts, golf course in the rooftop.. its ok.. Not too convenience for transportation, the only one near the hotel is a bus, if you want to use the subway, use the Ferrocarrill first and then the metro , if not walk, walk, walk..

Reviews.Title: “Try your next choice instead of this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hotkitkatos
Reviews.Content: I have never given as negative a review as this (it is not all that bad...) but I think it is justified. The 1st thing is the name should not apply. The golf area was closed when we arrived for check-in and they said that anyway the golf is only as lessons over the weekdays (no good for the weekend guests like us) Then there was the complementary tea or coffee which was in the corridor of the Hotel single floor. Early morning at 7 we thought of helping ourselves only to find that all the glasses had been used and not replaced with new ones. A similar situation in the evening was promptly informed to the Main desk and they got it replaced in 20 minutes! I would not mind then telling us the timing of the complementary coffee over the day! We booked two rooms one across the other which were not identical with one being quite small?! The free wifi is a great plus point & cleanliness is good otherwise... would sadly not recommend again.

Reviews.Title: “Fire the staff!”
Reviews.Author: MauldinFoodie
Reviews.Content: Get ready for the rudest *word that rhymes with fitch* on the planet running the front desk. She's got brown hair, black glasses, and two horns coming out of her head. I've never actually been to a hotel where I felt like the overall feel was this snooty! Literally, walked in with our luggage and got a nod... minutes pass... sarcasticly how can I help you. The extent of their hospitality was about as classy as a morning dump. Asking for good places to eat or directions and you might as well be asking for them to give you their liver. When I had a problem connecting to their wifi and asked about it, it was "oh obviously you are a dumba$$" with no hint of caring if they could just help me figure it out. I would say the rooms were just OK but when you have a devil who works in the lobby, it's hard to enjoy your time. Flash forward to check out - I paid in cash and asked for a receipt. pretty reasonable request right? WRONG. The bimbo at the front literally explodes and has a melt down. "Why do you need a receipt?!!? The bill is your receipt!!" "Uh no, that's a bill" I answer back. "If you could just sign it and say I paid, it would help a lot" NEXT SHE BEGINS HYPERVENTILATING. This chick starts slamming her first on the front desk, panting from apparently was the busiest request of the day, trying to sign her name. And the whole time, the ENTIRE staff has the attitude like "what, what the hell do you want". UM I JUST PAID YOU $150 for one nights stay, how about some damn customer service! Good luck if you stay here, give Satan my regards.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent @ its category”
Reviews.Author: NihanAydin
Reviews.Content: Very modern, stylie and cheap according to the other hotels in same category. A little far from metro but its easier to travel with the busses if you learn the numbers as the bus stop is @ front. Also a market next to it which is a plus i think.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: DammFineBeer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the Gracia district, almost 30 minutes walk from the Placa Catalunya. The staff on reception were friendly and approachable and the rooms were clean and a decent size. The only minor problem was that you could hear people talking in the room next door. Breakfast was buffet style and was taken in a small room with a pleasant terrace area which, had it not been January, we might have ventured onto. As other reviewers have stated, there is a decent size Caprabo supermarket next door which is quite handy for restocking the mini bar.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms very clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ViviJeff
Reviews.Content: The location is not so great if come from the airport by bus (aerobus), cos you have to get down on Plaza Catalunya and take the metro, and you'll have to walk up and down the stairs 'cos there aren't lifts and some stations... Despite this, is a great and comfortable hotel, there a supermarket right beside.

Reviews.Title: “A good, modern, simple hotel with easy links.....”
Reviews.Author: AdrianandJoan
Reviews.Content: A good little hotel (36 rooms) in what at first glance appears to be a little out of the way in terms of location - more later. Recently refurbished modern, clean, quiet and well presented, rated 2 stars due to the Barcelona rating system (e.g. a meeting room can move you from 3 to 4 stars apparently) because no bar or restaurant. Room we stayed in was of medium size, included desk, TV, minibar, chair, wardrobe and shelving and two large beds pushed together to make a double. Aircon (not used), Marble floors and completely marbled bathroom with bath, shower etc. made this feel much more than 2 stars. Cleaning and room servicing were excellent, as were the reception staff, who all had some English and were very helpful. Individual safe available in reception at no charge. We found a deal with breakfast included (unusual in Barcelona) at €90 a night, not cheap but not as expensive as a lot of hotels in Barcelona. Breakfast was very good continental style buffet - eat as much as you like, regularly topped up - same food available at 7.30 as at 11.00. Definitely recommended. Back to location - it looks a bit out of the way but is only 800m from Diagonal metro and, much better, lots of bus links close by, e.g. 14 and 17 to get down to the Ramblas, Barri Gotic, harbour etc. (and back), 16 to Montjuic, 32 to the Estacio Sants plus others to Parc Guell etc. only about 1000m to the Passeig de Gracia and the Modenist buildings. Tip: the 10 trip tickets are the best value way of getting around - we did a lot and our max use was 8 trips between us in a day - Two people can use them by putting it through the machine twice. You will not need more than zone 1.

Reviews.Title: “clean, cheap and well-located plus FREE Wi-Fi”
Reviews.Author: ernestjames
Reviews.Content: paid eur60 for a last minute booking online. hotel is v convenient location for ramblas de catalunya and calle balmes/av. diagonal area no frills, not charming, but comfy beds and easy access. plus not being ripped off for access to the wi-fi puts these guys high on my recommendation list. think easyjet but without the bright orange, and roughshod behaviour from staff and hidden scum-bag charges for vital extras (how does one pay if one cannot afford the credit card fee?)

Reviews.Title: “Medium Confort...Medium comfort! ( Does what it says on the tin)”
Reviews.Author: Lantana_UK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Medium Confort Sept 22nd - 25th 09 on a short break to Barcelona. The street and area is pleasant and safe with pavement cafes, bars and restaurants in the immediate vicinity . It is next door to a very good supermarket for basics, toiletries, alcohol, food, snacks or anything you may have forgotten. Avenue Diagonal runs parallel a stone's throw away for a taste of sophisticated retail therapy and a pleasant tree lined walk; and buses are very close by for a short ride across town or into the centre for La Rambla and Placa de Catalunya. For a short break - buy a T10 pass for 10 rides for both bus and metro with a 3month expiry date. Cost is about 7 Euros. Much cheaper than taxis! Hotel reception staff are very helpful if you need to know how to get around and are on duty 24/7. The hotel is clean, modern and has an intimate feel to it. The roof terrace is open all day for guests but only serves breakfast - although coffees can be bought at other times from a vending machine. -I didn't have breakfast in the hotel but it is only 5 Euros per person ...so if you are booking a holiday package and want to 'eat in' - don't pay for it through your booking ...! It's cheaper at the hotel itself. My double room was clean and modern and a comfortable size, with no signs of 'wear and tear' as was the bathroom. ( hairdryers are supplied and basic toiletries) Smoking rooms are available. It had a small tv with access to CNN and BBC World service for English speakers. Amenities include parking ( I am not sure if you are charged but there is a garage) and free use of internet in reception. The downside of this hotel..and it may be due to the room you are allocated..is the noise. My room - 136 - was the first at the top of the stairs from reception - (or from the lift ) - and the walls were paper thin! So much so that I became intimately aqcuainted with the bathroom habits of my 'neighbour' through the wall. I was also woken daily by the sounds of the hotel - guests leaving early or coming back late or cleaners, hotel staff and housekeeping starting their day. (I didn't ask to move as I was only there 3 nights, and being a smoker and a single traveller I figured my choice would be limited. ) Would I stay there again? -Yes for the reasonable price ( ( I booked through Travel Republic for £60 a night for single use of a double room) - and for ease of getting around and a safe, easy area to stay in - BUT only if I could be guarenteed a less noisy stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Niepce
Reviews.Content: GOOD: - excellent staff, very nice and helpful; - room very clean; - there is a huge supermarket near the hotel; - neighborhood is very nice and safe; - doesn't look like a 2 stars hotel, it's great! BAD: - thin walls between rooms, but this was not a big problem for us.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel....but...”
Reviews.Author: NickRLeeds
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in so many ways. It's clean, the staff are excellent and it's location isn't bad. The thing that lets it down so badly is the thin walls - you can hear people in the shower next door, with their TV on, talking in the corridor etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: HadasTlv
Reviews.Content: As was written at all of the reviews, this hotel was great value for money, pleasant, clean. The location is not at the center but buses served us well and it also gives you the opportunity to meet the "un touristic" Barcelona, the regular people. How to get to the hotel from the airport: take the “airobus” until 'plaza espaniya’ and from there take line 27- it takes you off at the hotel st. to get from the hotel to the center: by foot 30 minutes, bus lines 17,16 (1 minute walk from the hotel) and at night (from 23:00) line N5. To park Guel take line 24 (10 min walk from the hotel), to “monseratt” you take line 27 to plaza espaniya and from there you have train every hour (9:36, 10:36...) The hotel's neighborhood is very safe, quit, and note that although it is not on the “ramblas” (which is very noisy), there are a lot of shops near by, “avenida gracia” is 10 min walk, so it is a great choice. The stuff is helpful and nice. There is a big supermarket near the hotel. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Good Place”
Reviews.Author: NewDelhiAhmed
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel on the Travesera de Garcia road and easily accessible and reasonably priced. We like the staff which was very friendly and more than happy to advise us on where all to go in Barcelona in evenings. However the breakfast menu was a bit narrow for an asian traveler and I did not enjoy my breakfasts at this property. Even eggs were not on offer!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice&clean place”
Reviews.Author: est1vest2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Medium Confort for 6 nights in march 2009 and was very good impressed since the beginning, definetely doesn't look like a 2 stars hotel. I booked it via hotel site and got in the price of the room free wi-fi internet (good speed) and breakfast (they have the best coffee i've ever had in a buffet breakfast). Staff is very friendly and helpful, the first room they gave us was close to the elevator and stairs and i couldn's sleep because of the noise (people were coming and going all the time) so I asked for another room, they gave us another one without asking too much. It is located in a residential area (a supermarket and plaza Barcelona are nearby for shopping), 10-15 minutes to the closest metro stop and touristic bus station, but a few steps from bus stations going to Plaza Cataluna, Tibidabo, mall, Barceloneta etc. Not only that I would recommend this hotel, but I will surely stay there for the next visit in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “offers more than medium confort level”
Reviews.Author: naysen
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights, and I should say it is pretty good in terms of hotel staff, room facilities, breakfast, free wifi, and location. After a lot of hotel research, we were undecided between 2 hotels and at the end we made the right choice by choosing hotel medium confort. the other one was 4 stars hotel about the same price, but when you look at the neighborhood this is definitely a good place. Location: it is really 10-15 minutes walk to avenue diagonal and plaza catalunya. it is safe to walk at night, anyway the taxi drivers are nice and taxi prices in barcelona is affordable so overall i would say location is like soho of NYC, or Macka of Istanbul, etc. Reservation: please book it from the hotels webpage so you can get free wifi and free breakfast included in your deal. please note that you pay after check out although you provide them the credit card number while booking online. Hotel overall: you can be suprised it has one floor. the advantage, you pretty much know everybody after a day or two so it feels like a family. disadvantage the floor is not covered by wall to wall carpet so sometimes you can hear the cleaning ladies voice etc. Breakfast was good although it would have been better if they offered different things at different days just to have some variety. Room: the room offered the best confortable bed ever, seriously I never slept in such a nice confortable that:) the bathroom was spacious and clean. wifi was fast, and in the reception hall area a free wifi area with notebook was available for use to everybody. About Barcelona: 3 nights should be your minimum of stay because there is so much to see in this city. Clubbing style is different, they do not dress up much in here for clubbing, please note that otherwise you look like a call girl for them. you do not have to tip but 5-10 % would be nice if you think the service was excellent. sangrada familia, catalan history museum, les ramblas, la rambla, casa battlo are some of the must sees.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: Bevita
Reviews.Content: A charming and high-quality hotel, in a lovely neighborhood. Our room was clean and spacious, with free wi-fi, and a spacious bathroom. Nice outdoor light. For the price, a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Very nice, Clean and great breakfast. Well located”
Reviews.Author: liveinItaly
Reviews.Content: Hello, I selected the Hotel Medium Confort for a four day stay in Barcellona (first time). We booked 3 double rooms online at the hotels website. Tip: Book directly on their website as in doing so we got a discount and free breakfast (usually 11,00 Euro each). Not knowing Barcellona I wasn't sure about this location but it is a fantastic one. Near the end Passeg di Gracias which I can only compare to walking down 5th Avenue in New York and two metro lines it is in a very nice high class residential area (similar to Greenwich Village) area. While a lot of people told me to stay near the Ramblas which is considered the "center" I'm really glad I didn't take their advise... that area (sorry for all the NY comparisons) is similar to staying in a Spanish version of Times square... one block is nice and the next is not with lots of tourists and tourist traps. This hotel is very nicely located and we were very pleased with everything that had to do with our stay. You have a fridge in your room and right next door is a fully stocked supermarket so we were able to get some snacks and drinks to keep in our room. The rooms were spotless as were the sheets and linens (I'm a bit picky about those things.) and the staff was very helpful. All 6 of us thought it was a great deal. Would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: iano1550
Reviews.Content: This hotel is apparently only a 2 star but from the moment I arrived here I felt as if I was staying in at least an upper 3 star. The rooms were beautiful, basic and immaculate Bathroom was large and clean and the breakfast on the rooftop terrace the next morning was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Sylish Confort”
Reviews.Author: Bath_Rob
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel is tastefully decorated in a modern style and our room was beautifully clean & tidy when we stayed in Sept. 2006. The friendly English speaking reception staff were helpful and the hotel is well maintained. Our adequately sized room faced the road but this was quiet at night and the walls seemed to be well sound-proofed so we were not disturbed by noise from adjoining rooms. The cold buffet breakfast was good with the opporunity to eat on the terrace in fine weather. We often used the Diagonal Metro station at the top end of the Passieg de Gracia which is 10 minutes walk from the hotel. This gave us cheap & quick access to anywhere in the city. The Gaudi sites of La Padrera & Casa Batllo are near this statiion and there are fine shops, restaurants & bars along the Passieg de Gracia . We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who would like to stay in the quieter, more upmarket Gracia area.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Palmier
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was lovely. The minute we walked in the staff were extremely friendly and welcoming. If you ever had a question or query they were more than happy to help. The rooms were clean and tidy and perfect for a city break. The hotel was a little further from the centre than I thought when I booked it but found getting around on the trains and metro were very easy. The nearest station is about a 2 minute walk away. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: tap216
Reviews.Content: A very good deal at the around $100 I paid. Very nice staff (very young, seemed to work there night and day...) very clean/new rooms (modern style). Decent breakfast on a outdoor patio. A bit away from the center, but close to subway and only a few minutes to the center.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Hotel Confort Golf
HotelInfo.Address: Travessera de Gracia 72, 08006 Barcelona, Spain
